Join us this week for Open Source Friday as we welcome Phil Miller and Theo Ephraim, the creators of varlock! varlock is an open source tool designed to make .env files safer and more useful for teams. Built on a simple DSL called @env-spec (RFC), varlock helps teams manage configuration and secrets with ease and security.

comments.text: Incredible journey for Git! It's inspiring to see how the community continues to innovate and push boundaries after 20 years. Looking forward to what's next for all of us at Git Merge 2025.

scraped_data.text:
On this stream of Open Source Friday, we're excited to shine a spotlight on Mockoon - the open source tool that makes API mocking fast, easy, and local! 

Whether you're developing, testing, or learning, Mockoon can help you simulate APIs with just a few clicks. Mockoon Cloud allows data synchronization, collaboration, and instant deployment. 

Join us as we chat with Guillaume Monnet, creator and maintainer behind Mockoon to explore how this project is shaping the future of API development.

comments.author: PlanBnext
comments.subtitle: 646 followers
comments.text: The focus on Mockoon highlights an exciting advancement in API development. It's inspiring to see tools that streamline workflows and foster collaboration. I look forward to learning more from your conversation with Guillaume Monnet about the impact of this project on the open source community.

comments.author: Mockoon
comments.subtitle: 493 followers
comments.text: We‚Äôre thrilled to see Mockoon highlighted on Open Source Friday üéâ Thanks GitHub for the opportunity to share our work with the community.

comments.author: Guillaume Monnet
comments.subtitle: Founder @ Mockoon - Fractional CTO & Technical Advisor
comments.text: Thanks a lot for the spotlight üôå Really looking forward to chatting about Mockoon‚Äôs journey and API mocking with the community!

comments.author: Marcella dePunzio
comments.subtitle: Developers Ignore Traditional Marketing | DevTools Deserve Technical Storytellers | I Translate Complex Products into Value That Inspires, Educates, and Drives Adoption Across AI & Infra Teams
comments.text:
Open Source Friday spotlights on specific tools like Mockoon create developer education value beyond just showcasing GitHub features. The local API mocking approach addresses real development workflow pain points when external APIs are unavailable or unreliable.

Which aspect of API mocking do you think developers struggle with most - setting up realistic response scenarios or managing mock data synchronization across team environments?

comments.author: Guillaume Monnet
comments.subtitle: Founder @ Mockoon - Fractional CTO & Technical Advisor
comments.text:
Marcella dePunzio I think keeping mocks up-to-date and in sync is one of the major struggle. 
Also, while a solution like the OpenAPI specification is good for design/testing, it is not ideal for mocking/simulating as it fail to describe those advanced scenarios (matching rules notably).

comments.author: rabbito
comments.subtitle: 17,649 followers
comments.text: Happy to see GitHub spotlighting Mockoon! Making API mocking so easy really takes the stress out of development.
